<<<api>>>: Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler
<<<code>>>: 
public class MyExceptionHandler implements Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler {
    public void uncaughtException(Thread t, Throwable e) {
        LOGGER.error("Uncaught Exception in thread: " + t.getName(), e);
    }
}

public class MyServlet extends HttpServlet {
    public void init() {
        Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler(new MyExceptionHandler());
    }

    protected void doPost(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse resp) {
        try {
            int i = 1/0;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler().uncaughtException(Thread.currentThread(), e);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The UncaughtExceptionHandler is not catching the exception because the doPost method is not running in the same thread where you set the UncaughtExceptionHandler. In a servlet environment, each request is handled in a separate thread. Therefore, you need to set the UncaughtExceptionHandler in the same thread where the exception might occur. In the provided code, we set the UncaughtExceptionHandler in the init method of the servlet which is called once when the servlet is loaded. Then, in the doPost method, we manually call the uncaughtException method of the UncaughtExceptionHandler whenever an exception occurs.
